status: MARC21-007: Medium for sound of motion pictures
Specific medium used to carry the sound of an item (whether that sound is carried on the item itself or is in the form of accompanying material) and the type of sound playback required.

definition (en): Sound is not present (i.e., the item is intended to be silent).

preferred label (en): optical sound track on motion picture film
definition (en): Sound to accompany a motion picture is carried on an optical track that is part of the film.
scope note (en): Optical sound is the most commonly used process for 16 and 35 mm. film.

preferred label (en): magnetic sound track on motion picture film
definition (en): Sound to accompany a motion picture is carried on a separate magnetic track that is part of the film.
scope note (en): 70 mm. motion picture films often include magnetic sound tracks.

definition (en): Accompanying sound is carried on a magnetic audio tape cartridge.
Sound to accompany an item is carried on a sound disc.
scope note (en): Sound discs include 7, 10, and 12 in. vinyl phonograph records and 4 3/4 in. compact discs.

definition (en): Sound to accompany an item is carried on a reel of magnetic audio tape.
Sound to accompany an item is carried on a cassette of magnetic audio tape.

preferred label (en): optical and magnetic sound track on motion picture film
definition (en): Sound to accompany a motion picture is carried on both an optical and magnetic track.
Sound to accompany an item is included as part of a videotape.
scope note (en): Videotape is not ordinarily used to record only sound.

definition (en): Sound to accompany an item is included as part of a videodisc.
scope note (en): Videodiscs are not ordinarily used to record only sound. A distinction must be made between videodiscs (e.g., 12 in. laser-scan videodiscs that include video information) and compact discs that are used to record sound only (e.g., 4 3/4 in. audio compact discs). The technology to physically record video or audio information on digital disc systems is the same.

definition (en): Medium for sound is not known.

Medium for sound other than no sound (silent), optical sound track on motion picture film, magnetic sound track on motion picture film, magnetic audio tape in cartridge, sound disc, magnetic audio tape on reel, magnetic audio tape in cassette, optical and magnetic sound track on motion picture film, videotape, videodisc.
